e1470e2a-b947-4562-b947-c240f213efa6.description: CPAs who earn the AICPA's Certified in Financial Forensics (CFF) credential demonstrate expertise in forensic accounting through competency, experience and adherence to professional standards, in a manner withstanding enhanced levels of scrutiny. Badge earners apply their expertise to areas like fraud, financial statement misrepresentation, family law services, damages calculations and investigation. Credential holders commit to continued development in specialized and investigative knowledge.
e1470e2a-b947-4562-b947-c240f213efa6.name: Certified in Financial Forensics (CFF®) Credential

issuer.summary: issued by American Institute of CPAs

badge_template_activities.title: Hold an active, valid and unrevoked CPA license or a certificate issued by a legally constituted state authority
Pass the CFF credential exam

Complete 75-hours of forensic-related continuing professional development (CPD) or complete the AICPA’s online direct pathway consisting of 59-hours of CPD within the 5-year period preceding the date of the credential application

Attest to meeting the minimum business requirements (at least 1,000 hours of forensic experience) or academic requirements (full-time faculty, teaching two courses related to 50% of CFF content specification outline)
Member of American Institute of Certified Public Accountants ("AICPA"), and subject to the AICPA's Code of Professional Conduct
To maintain the CFF credential, complete at least 20 hours of continuing professional development within the credential body of knowledge annually

f75cb394-2bdf-4ae9-8a21-e17f69a48330.description: CPAs and qualified valuation professionals who earn the Accredited in Business Valuation (ABV) credential demonstrate expertise in business valuation through their competency, experience and adherence to professional standards. Badge earners perform and review valuations of businesses , business ownership interests, securities, and intangible assets as trusted advisors. Credential holders commit to continued development in valuation methods and theory.
f75cb394-2bdf-4ae9-8a21-e17f69a48330.name: Accredited in Business Valuation (ABV®) Credential

issuer.summary: issued by American Institute of CPAs

badge_template_activities.title: All candidates: Pass the ABV or equivalent credential exam
All candidates: 75-hours of valuation-related continuing professional development (CPD) within the 5-year period preceding the date of the credential application
CPAs: Hold an active, valid and unrevoked CPA license or a certificate issued by a legally constituted state authority
CPAs: 1,500 hours of valuation experience within the 5-year period preceding the date of the credential application
Valuation professionals: Hold a bachelor’s degree and complete the AICPA Professional Conduct and Standards Education for Finance Professionals course
Valuation professionals: 4,500 hours of valuation experience within the 5-year period preceding the date of the credential application
Member of American Institute of Certified Public Accountants ("AICPA"), and subject to the AICPA's Code of Professional Conduct
To maintain the ABV credential, complete 4 hours of professional ethics and 60 hours of continuing professional development every 3 years

822dc128-d83b-44ae-966a-1b47c1405389.description: CPAs who earn the AICPA's Personal Financial Specialist (PFS™) credential badge specialize in financial planning with individuals, families, and business owners, through all the ins and outs of life. Badge holders advise and assist clients in planning the areas of their lives, such as taxes, investments, estates, retirement, and insurance. Credential holders commit to continued development in these areas as well as charitable, elder, college/education, and employee benefit planning.
822dc128-d83b-44ae-966a-1b47c1405389.name: Personal Financial Specialist (PFS™) Credential

issuer.summary: issued by American Institute of CPAs

badge_template_activities.title: Hold a valid and unrevoked CPA license, permit or certificate issued by a legally constituted state authority
Pass the PFS or equivalent credential exam
Complete threshold of continuing professional development in personal financial planning topics prior to applying
Attest to meeting the required hours of personal financial planning experience prior to applying
Member of American Institute of Certified Public Accountants ("AICPA"), and subject to the AICPA's Code of Professional Conduct
Complete at least 20 hours of continuing professional development within the credential body of knowledge annually

90e1c89f-ce55-43ba-a8a5-868b6c7fde47.description: CPAs and recognized equivalents who earn the AICPA's Certified Information Technology Professional (CITP) credential demonstrate skills within the always-evolving topics of technology and finance. Badge earners are trusted advisors that develop and maintain policies and programs in areas like IT governance and assurance; cybersecurity risk evaluation; and data analytics and management. Credential holders commit to continued development in solutions related to IT and technology assurance trends.
90e1c89f-ce55-43ba-a8a5-868b6c7fde47.name: Certified Information Technology Professional (CITP®) Credential

issuer.summary: issued by American Institute of CPAs

badge_template_activities.title: Hold a valid and unrevoked CPA license, active permit or certificate issued by a legally constituted state authority
Pass the CITP credential exam
Attest to meeting the minimum of 1,000 hours of business experience in the CITP credential body of knowledge within the 5-year period preceding the date of credential application
Member of American Institute of Certified Public Accountants ("AICPA"), and subject to the AICPA's Code of Professional Conduct
Complete at least 20 hours of continuing professional development within the credential body of knowledge annually

38369cb1-4d81-4167-8d42-538e759dbbd5.description: CPAs and finance professionals who earn the AICPA's Certified in Entity and Intangible Valuations (CEIV) credential execute high-quality fair value measurements when performing valuations for financial reporting purposes. Badge earners value business combinations, test goodwill and other accounts for impairment and estimate fair value of intangible assets. Credential holders commit to continued development by complying with the Mandatory Performance Framework (MPF) and Application of the MPF.
38369cb1-4d81-4167-8d42-538e759dbbd5.name: Certified in Entity and Intangible Valuations (CEIV™) Credential

issuer.summary: issued by American Institute of CPAs

badge_template_activities.title: Pass a qualifying valuation assessment
Pass the CEIV credential exam
Attest to meeting the minimum of 3,000 hours of experience performing fair value measurements in the 10 years preceding application with at least half (1,500 hours) in the preceding 5 years
Member of American Institute of Certified Public Accountants ("AICPA"), and subject to the AICPA's Code of Professional Conduct

To maintain the credential, individuals must meet ongoing continuing professional development (CPD) requirements, comply with the Mandatory Performance Framework and participate in ongoing Quality Monitoring process.

To maintain the credential, individuals must perform 1,500 hours of fair value measurement-related work every 5-year period. In addition, credential holders must complete a mandatory 8-hour fair value measurement update annually PLUS 40 hours of fair value measurement-related education every 5-year period.

Note: The trademarks CEIV and CERTIFIED IN ENTITY AND INTANGIBLE VALUATIONS are owned by Corporate and Intangibles Valuation Organizations, LLC, and are used under license agreements between Corporate and Intangibles Valuation Organization, LLC and RICS, ASA and AICPA.

ca8c9079-d366-4afe-92f3-714c43fed3dd.description: CPAs and valuation professionals who earn the AICPA's Certified in the Valuation of Financial Instruments (CVFI) credential badge demonstrate considerable expertise in performing and reporting on fair value estimates of financial instruments for financial reporting purposes. Badge holders execute supportable and auditable fair value estimates Credential holders commit to continued development This includes estimating the fair value of derivatives, structured products, securitized debt and more.
ca8c9079-d366-4afe-92f3-714c43fed3dd.name: Certified in the Valuation of Financial Instruments (CVFI™) Credential

issuer.summary: issued by American Institute of CPAs

badge_template_activities.title: Pass the CVFI credential exam
Complete the required pre-certification education
Conventional pathway - attest to meeting at least 3,000 hours of experience performing fair value estimates for financial instruments in the 5-year period preceding credential application
Experienced pathway - attest to meeting at least 6,000 hours of experience performing fair value estimates for financial instruments in the 10-year period preceding credential application
Member of American Institute of Certified Public Accountants ("AICPA"), and subject to the AICPA's Code of Professional Conduct

To maintain the credential, individuals must complete 8-hours of financial instruments related continuing professional development (CPD) annually, comply with the Financial Instrument Performance Framework and participate in ongoing Quality Monitoring process
To maintain the credential, individuals must perform 1,500 hours of work related to fair value estimates for financial instruments every 5-year period
